title: Anti-Doping Policy Research Group
abstractText:
Seminar aims to:

  • strengthen research capacity in relation to the issue of doping in sport
  • stimulate cross disciplinary research proposals on doping in sport
  • inform anti-doping policy and practice.

In relation to the first aim the seminars:

  • developed strong links between researchers in the UK and their European colleagues
  • developed a network of contacts across disciplines among UK-based researchers
  • facilitated networking between academics and research users.

With regard to the second aim there has been some cross-disciplinary research arising from participation in the seminars. Examples include the preparation of joint conference papers and a cross-disciplinary bid for research funding.

In relation to the third aim a number of participants subsequently undertook research either funded by national and international anti-doping organisations or by funded by generic research agencies but with the support of anti-doping organisations. These funding and research opportunities were the product of relationships between researchers and research users which were either initiated or reinforced during the seminar series.

Continuing momentum arising out of the seminar series is evident in two areas - publications (eleven papers from the series subsequently published in peer reviewed journals) and continuing funded research.
